title: Heart Health with Herbs: What Ayurveda Recommends
author: Harish
excerpt: Arjuna and hibiscus are valuable Ayurvedic allies for circulation and heart resilience—learn how to use them safely alongside medical care.
content:
Ayurvedic Perspective on the Heart

Ayurveda names the heart (hridaya) as central to physical and emotional vitality. Herbs used traditionally—like arjuna—are considered supportive for heart strength and resilience.

What Arjuna & Hibiscus Offer

  • Arjuna: Classical herb used for cardiac support and stamina.
  • Hibiscus: Cooling, antioxidant-rich, and supportive for healthy blood pressure.
  • Rosehip: Adds vitamin C and antioxidant balance.

How to Integrate Herbal Heart Support

  • Use tea as a supportive daily habit (1–2 cups).
  • Combine with heart-healthy diet (whole grains, greens, healthy fats).
  • Maintain movement, stress reduction, and sleep for cardiovascular resilience.

Medical Safety

Herbal teas are supportive; they are not replacements for prescribed heart medications. Always coordinate with your healthcare provider and monitor blood pressure when starting new cardiovascular herbs.
